replies.body:
"the sight of this rebellious girl hefting his severed arm over her head would be the turning point of the war."

YEAH GURL!!

I wanted this to be the illustration for the title.

I was down-voted IRL. :-(
{{champion:50}} "Am I to seek revenge for my poor departed arm? If anything, girl, you did me a favor."

True! True! But in that moment it would be safe to guess he would die from those wounds. Unfortunately for Irelia, Swain aint no bitch.

Its also just such good imagery.

True. I like how champs in League right now are able to win victories over one another without the loser appearing much less competent as a result.

This is a problem that plagues a lot of other games with lores (e.g. Reaper in Overwatch)
The Lee Sin short story is not new, it came out quite a bit ago.
That was my bad sorry xD
Oh,No i linked the wrong short story there.i was too excited i lost it! :D i blame you guys!
No worries, it is still good to raise awareness for lore pieces.

My heart D:. For so long I desired Zelos to be a champion in league, now rip both him and her father.

Personally I would have preferred the dances to be taught to her by her father as it would have kept in line more with the old irelia lore and her father and brother having died alone in a bloody confrontation defending their village only to have irelia finish it. It also would have avoided the stereotype of grandmother to granddaughter teaching the old ways. 

Now her father Lito and Zelos just feel thrown in as homages to her old lore instead of real parts of her lore.

Regardless I still love this update!
This is a really nice observation! give me a new prespective on what i read. thank you.

I liked her more when she learned a fighting technique from her father, not dancing. I also think she was more badass when she was almost killed by Noxians, then her soul tied to her blades by Soraka.
